Description: Granodiorite figure of Sekhmet, seated, with a solar disk headdress. Front of plinth and feet was restored and this restoration has all detached. Inscribed on front edges of throne with names of Amenhotep III.
Curator's comments: Published: HTBM Part 9: Plate I PM II (2): p.265
Bibliographic references: James 1970 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 9. (Pl.1)
Exhibition history: 1954. Requested for loan to temporary exhibition at Birmingham City Museum and Art Gallery (AES archive, Official Correspondence 1953-55, note of 21 January 1954, with application dated 21 September 1953).
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
